citations.narrative:
The facility is not providing adequate space to all of its dogs. The facility is housing 4 weaned 11 week old corgi puppies
together in a single enclosure that measures 30.5” x 29” (6.14sqft). All 4 corgi puppies are approximately the same size
and a single puppy was measured at 17”, requiring 3.67sqft of floor space per puppy. When housed together, all four
corgi puppies need a minimum floor space of 14.69sqft. In another enclosure measuring 30.5” x 30” (6.35sqft), the facility
is housing 3 weaned 12 week old beagle puppies together. All 3 beagle puppies are approximately the same size and a
single puppy was measured at 15”, requiring 3.06sqft of floor space per puppy. When housed together, all 3 beagle
puppies need a minimum floor space of 9.18sqft. When dogs are overcrowded, they can’t make normal postural
adjustments and may fight for resources. All dogs, including weaned puppies, must be provided a minimum amount of
floor space in their primary enclosure that can be calculated by measuring the dog from the tip of its nose to the base of
its tail and then adding 6”. The resulting number should be multiplied by itself to get minimum floor space in square inches
and divided by 144 to get minimum floor space in square feet. When housing multiple dogs together, the enclosure needs
to be the sum of all minimum floor space calculations for each dog. Correct by 7/25/25.

The facility does not have a documented exercise plan and is not providing exercise opportunity to 1 dog. An 18 week old
poodle puppy is being housed by himself in an enclosure that measures 30.5” x 29” ( 6.14sqft). The puppy measures 20”,
which requires a minimum floor space of 4.69sqft. The puppy is not currently being allowed opportunity to exercise
outside of his enclosure and his enclosure does not meet twice his minimum required floor space of 9.39sqft. Dogs that
are not allowed adequate opportunity to exercise can develop mental distress and abnormal behaviors. All dealers must
develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide dogs over the age of 12 weeks with the opportunity for
exercise and is approved by the attending veterinarian. The plan can include group housing with minimum floor space for
each dog, individual housing with twice minimum floor space, or access to an open area at a frequency and duration
specified by the attending veterinarian. Correct by 7/31/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.6(c)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The facility is not providing adequate space to all of its dogs. The facility is housing 4 weaned 11 week old corgi puppies 
together in a single enclosure that measures 30.5” x 29” (6.14sqft). All 4 corgi puppies are approximately the same size 
and a single puppy was measured at 17”, requiring 3.67sqft of floor space per puppy. When housed together, all four 
corgi puppies need a minimum floor space of 14.69sqft. In another enclosure measuring 30.5” x 30” (6.35sqft), the facility 
is housing 3 weaned 12 week old beagle puppies together. All 3 beagle puppies are approximately the same size and a 
single puppy was measured at 15”, requiring 3.06sqft of floor space per puppy. When housed together, all 3 beagle 
puppies need a minimum floor space of 9.18sqft. When dogs are overcrowded, they can’t make normal postural 
adjustments and may fight for resources. All dogs, including weaned puppies, must be provided a minimum amount of 
floor space in their primary enclosure that can be calculated by measuring the dog from the tip of its nose to the base of 
its tail and then adding 6”. The resulting number should be multiplied by itself to get minimum floor space in square inches 
and divided by 144 to get minimum floor space in square feet. When housing multiple dogs together, the enclosure needs 
to be the sum of all minimum floor space calculations for each dog. Correct by 7/25/25. 
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
The facility does not have a documented exercise plan and is not providing exercise opportunity to 1 dog. An 18 week old 
poodle puppy is being housed by himself in an enclosure that measures 30.5” x 29” ( 6.14sqft). The puppy measures 20”, 
which requires a minimum floor space of 4.69sqft. The puppy is not currently being allowed opportunity to exercise 
outside of his enclosure and his enclosure does not meet twice his minimum required floor space of 9.39sqft. Dogs that 
are not allowed adequate opportunity to exercise can develop mental distress and abnormal behaviors. All dealers must 
develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide dogs over the age of 12 weeks with the opportunity for 
exercise and is approved by the attending veterinarian. The plan can include group housing with minimum floor space for 
each dog, individual housing with twice minimum floor space, or access to an open area at a frequency and duration 
specified by the attending veterinarian. Correct by 7/31/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

n
